info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:05PM MDT until May 24 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HARDING AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES... At 605 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles west of Hayden, or 18 miles west of Amistad, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clayton and Sedan. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 428 and 429. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
